original_title: V Holistic managed security solution by H One for strengthened cybersecurity at CBL
original_body_lines: In a significant initiative to help businesses focus on their core operations while managing cybersecurity, H One has successfully implemented a comprehensive managed security solution for the Ceylon Biscuits Limited (CBL) Group. This robust service leverages Microsoft Sentinel, integrated with Microsoft 365 Defender and other Microsoft solutions, to provide unparalleled threat detection and incident response capabilities.

The collaboration between H One and CBL Group aims to fortify CBL’s cybersecurity defences. This includes comprehensive reviews of the entire IT infrastructure—datacenters, cloud environments, and physical security controls. Additionally, the implementation of asset valuation and patch management processes ensures timely updates and threat mitigation.

“We greatly appreciate the outstanding support given to us by the CBL team, which has enabled H One to successfully deploy Microsoft Sentinel at CBL. This achievement marks a significant milestone in hardening CBL’s cybersecurity posture. With this advanced solution, we have greatly enhanced the CBL team’s capability to detect and respond to threats in real-time, ensuring robust protection for their organisation.” – Venura Mendis, CEO of H One.

Microsoft Sentinel is a scalable, cloud-native security information and event management (SIEM) platform that also offers security orchestration, automation, and response (SOAR). It delivers advanced cyber threat detection, investigation, response, and proactive threat hunting, offering a bird’s-eye view across the entire enterprise.

“H One’s support has been crucial in maintaining our software. Their team provided invaluable training to our IT and security operations teams, helping us uphold standards and stay ahead of potential threats.” – Keshan Dayaratne, Chief Information Officer, CBL.

The solution implemented by H One aggregates log data from across CBL’s IT infrastructure, including applications, networks, security devices, and host systems. By collecting and analysing this data, Microsoft Sentinel identifies security incidents and events, generating real-time alerts and detailed reports on potential threats.

The solution not only provides continuous monitoring but also includes features such as proactive threat hunting, historical data analysis, forensic analysis, and the automation of SOAR tasks. Microsoft Sentinel’s built-in AI accelerates data analysis, pulling in information from diverse sources including users, applications, servers, and devices across both on-premises and cloud environments.

Key capabilities of Microsoft Sentinel include data aggregation, advanced analytics and threat intelligence, automated response, and in-depth incident analysis. Through this partnership, CBL Group benefits from a lower total cost of ownership, streamlined security operations, and a unified approach to threat detection, investigation, and response.
